title: Broad bean houmous
time: Takes 40 minutes to make, 5 minutes to cook
description: Broad bean houmous (hummus) is a lighter alternative to its chickpea cousin. Serve with lightly-toasted flatbreads or baby carrots and sugar snap peas.
ingredients: A few toasted sesame seeds to garnish

method.Step 1: Drop the beans into a pan of well-salted boiling water, bring back to the boil and cook for 4-5 minutes or until quite tender. Drain, reserving a little of the cooking water. Refresh under cold water, then nick the sides of each bean with your fingernail and pop out the bright green beans.

method.Step 2: Put the beans into a food processor with 1 tbsp of the cooking water, the garlic, tahini paste, lemon juice and ¾ tsp of salt, then blend to a very smooth purée. With the motor still running, very gradually pour in the oil. Season to taste.

method.Step 3: Spoon the mixture into a small bowl and sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve straightaway.
